title.narrative: Emergency Assistance to the households severely affected by floods 2021 in Cox’s Bazar

description.narrative:
The rise in water levels of the Sangu, the Matamuhuri and the Bankkhali rivers caused by continuous heavy rains in August 2021 have worsened and flood water inundated hundreds of villages under Bandarban sadar, Thanchi, Lama, Alikadam and Naikhongchhari upazilas in Bandarban district and Ukhiya, Teknaf and Moheshkhali upazilas under Cox’s bazar district in Bangladesh.
As per the findings and recommendations of the needs assessment, CB will provide multi-purpose cash grants to meet up affected HHs urgent essentials, cash support for shelter repair as well, and create temporary employment opportunities under CFW activities. Caritas’ timely assistance will fill a significant gap in the response in these communities which have been devastated by flood. Caritas is positioned for immediate response, and will leverage its extensive experience implementing community-based shelter programming in the nationally and globally to ensure quality implementation that is responsive to the needs of diverse populations within the affected communities.
